results.title: Far from Heaven
results.creator_credit: Todd Haynes, Christine Vachon, Jody Patton, Focus Features and Vulcan Productions
results.brief_description: Mrs Cathy Whitaker (Julianne Moore) is the equivalent of the 1950s super mom - running the household for her busy executive husband and two young children with the help of her African American maid Sybil. She has a busy social circle, doing good deeds for the community, all whilst being impeccably dressed and coiffured. But this nuclear family is not what it seems as the husband (Dennis Quaid) has a secret passion that cannot be quelled. A friendship with the gardener (Dennis Haysbert), an African American single father, develops into something deeper for Cathy but society deems their acquaintance as simply unacceptable. A film about relationships and society where people’s desires and needs are often at odds with a repressed moral code/sense of ethics, especially in 1950s America. Written and directed by Todd Haynes, with music by Elmer Bernstein. Highly stylised art direction and costume design appropriate to the period. Cast includes Viola Davis, Patricia Clarkson, Celia Weston.

results.title: Dirty pretty things
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Robert Jones, Tracey Seaward, BBC Film Unit and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: An illegal immigrant in urban London, Okwe, is working as a cab driver and doing the nightshift as a hotel receptionist (Chiwetel Ejiofor). He is sharing a flat with one of the hotel’s maids, Senay, (Audrey Tautou’s first English speaking role) who is also an illegal but dreams of escaping to live in America. Initially the film is more a character study of the pair always living in fear of deportation and struggling with poverty but soon develops into a thriller as one night, a gruesome discovery in room 510’s blocked toilet, leads to blackmail and involvement with London’s sordid underworld. Cast includes Sergi Lopez, Benedict Wong and Sophie Okonedo.

results.title: Super size me
results.creator_credit: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Roadside Attractions, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Showtime Independent
results.brief_description: Eating nothing but McDonald’s for one month, Morgan Spurlock discovers the effects of fast-food first-hand. Under medical supervision, he proves by his experiment that junk food does make you sick - and while it is a bit extreme to eat “Maccas” three meals a day, the film shows how American society is making itself unwell by eating fast food in great amounts and that obesity is one of the largest causes of illness and death in the country. The “Super Size” refers to the larger sizes on offer and Morgan makes the rule that when offered a Super Size he must eat it! Winner of Best Director 2004 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: The film "Dogville" as told in nine chapters and a prologue
results.creator_credit: Lars Von Trier, Vibeke Windelov and Zentropa Entertainments8 APS
results.brief_description: Lars Von Trier’s films are distinctive and this film is no exception having been shot not unlike televised theatre of the 1970s with a stark stage-like set. Grace (Nicole Kidman) arrives in the township of Dogville as a fugitive running from a team of gangsters and seeking a safe haven. After some convincing from self-appointed town leader/philosopher Tom (Paul Bettany) the town agrees to hide her but at what price? Do they stay loyal to Grace or is the townsfolk’s reckoning worse for Grace than the band of gangsters? Official selection for Cannes 2003. Cast includes Jean-Marc Barr, Lauren Bacall, Harriet Andersson and James Caan.

results.title: The Hours
results.creator_credit: Stephen Daldry, Robert Fox, Scott Rudin, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Faithful adaptation of Michael Cunningham’s acclaimed novel “The Hours”, garnered numerous Academy Award nominations including Best Actress prize for Nicole Kidman as Virginia Woolf. Using a three-episode structure the narrative shifts between the 1930s, 1950s and early 2000 with three women linked by the Woolf novel “Mrs Dalloway”. In the first part Woolf is depicted struggling with her novel and her waning mental health; next a suburban housewife and mother Laura Brown (Julianne Moore) is reading “Mrs Dalloway”, questioning her happiness and desire to live; lastly Clarissa Vaughn (Meryl Streep) is preparing a lavish dinner party for a dying friend who has won a celebrated literary prize. On this one day each woman experiences an array of emotions, including desire, despair and a yearning for something more; all are linked by motifs such as a kiss, interweaving their individual plights. As well the superb key performances, “The Hours” is bolstered by a strong supporting cast (Claire Danes, Ed Harris, Jeff Daniels, Allison Janney and Toni Collette), a lyrical Michael Nyman score and a pervasive air of melancholy and longing.

results.title: Ring 0: Birthday = Ringu 0: Basudei
results.creator_credit: Norio Tsuruta, Masao Nagai, Takashige Ichise, Asmik Ace Entertainment and Ring 0 Production Group
results.brief_description: Ring O: Birthday, a prequel to the phenomenally successful “Ring” and “Ring 2” films by Hideo Nakata, provides the back-story of Sadako - the murdering, vengeful spirit that haunts the living via video-tape. Set in the 1960s, Sadako is a shy student, who earns the wrath of her colleagues when she attracts the attention of the drama club director. Suspicions about Sadako rise when mysterious deaths start to occur. With less thrills and shocks of the originals, “Ring 0” still impresses with its tension and dramatic staging of Sadako’s tragic past. Cast includes Yukie Nakama, Seiichi Tanabe and Yoshiko Tanaka.

results.title: 24 Hour party people
results.creator_credit: Michael Winterbottom, Andrew Eaton, Baby Cow, Film Consortium, Film Council, Film Four International, Revolution Films and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This mockumentary is set during Manchester’s rise in the music world from the late 70’s post punk era through to the 80’s rave scene. Inspired by the Sex Pistols Tony Wilson (Steve Coogan) a Cambridge graduate television presenter, starts a record label signing up the band “Joy Division” and then on to running the “Hacienda” nightclub. From depressive post punk morbidness comes “New Order” and then “Happy Mondays” are found. This hedonistic and exciting film shot on digital video shows well the life of drugs, excess and seedy dealing that go hand in hand with the music industry. “24 Hour Party People” is very funny. Those who were around during this important era will enjoy the soundtrack and reminisce to the sounds of “Joy Division”, “New Order”, “Buzzcocks”, “The Clash” and the “Happy Mondays”. Tough Northern humour, outrageous self abuse and self mocking throughout this is a fine portrayal of the Manchester music scene.

results.title: The Pianist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Alain Sarde, Robert Benmussa and Studio Canal
results.brief_description: An epic but true tale of the pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman’s struggle as a Polish Jew to survive World War II. Based on a book by Szpilman, Ronald Harwood’s Academy Award winning screenplay covers the period of the second World War. Roman Polanski’s skill in motion picture storytelling is evident here as he is also a winner of the Academy Award for Best Director. The film received seven nominations in all, most notably the Best Actor Award going to Adrien Brody for his portrayal of Szpilman. A gifted composer and pianist, Szpilman was making regular appearances on Polish radio when the Nazis overran Warsaw. His family are taken to the walled Ghetto where Szpilman is able to make a meagre living by playing piano in a cafe where the more affluent and sometimes corrupt Jewish people dine. He narrowly escapes the fate of his family’s trip to the death camps and survives with the help of friends and his own instinct and just pure willpower. A sympathetic German officer who is moved by his talent also spares and sustains his life. A moving portrayal of the plight of Polish Jews but one which also shows that there are good and bad people on every side during times of war. Special edition two-disc set including a thirty-minute documentary on the making of the film. Other Awards include the Palme D’Or at Cannes 2002. Cast includes Thomas Kretschmann.

results.title: Thirteen conversations about one thing = 13 conversations ab
results.creator_credit: Jill Sprecher, Beni Atoori, Gina Resnick, Echo Lake Productions and Stonelock Pictures
results.brief_description: What is happiness? Through the journey of the everyday, five individuals’ lives link in a way that alters their fate or outlook. Karma, hope and fate are explored in this tale set in amongst busy city dwellers all with the need to answer life’s eternal questions of ‘what is life?’, ‘what’s in it for me?’ and even ‘how do I relate to others?’ Co-written and directed by Jill Sprecher. Stellar ensemble cast includes John Turturro, Matthew McConaughey, Clea DuVall, Amy Irving, Tia Texada, Barbara Sukowa, Alan Arkin.

results.title: Who knows? = Va Savoir
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rivette, Martine Marignac, Artificial Eye, Canal+ and Pierre Grise
results.brief_description: Urbane theatre is the setting for Jacques Rivette’s romantic comedy, revolving around the love affairs (past and present) of six individuals. When Camille returns to Paris to star in a new play she is reunited with a soon-to-be-married old flame; meanwhile her director/lover becomes intrigued by an ingenue who is assisting him locate a long-lost Italian play, whose brother is swindling a vulnerable woman. In this droll work, Rivette contentedly draws on the “life is art” theme, whilst the leisurely pace allows his protagonists to explore their entanglements with an appealing mix of contemplation and whimsy.
